name: Yellow Submarine Quiz | Yellow Submarine | 10 Questions

questions.text: What author was one of the writers for "Yellow Submarine"?
questions.explanation:
Erich Segal.

	Erich Segal is most famous for writing the bestseller "Love Story".  The other contributing writers were Al Brodax, Roger McGough, Jack Mendelsohn and Lee Minoff.

questions.text: Who is attributed the lyrics "Sky of blue, sea of green. In our yellow submarine" in the title song?
questions.explanation:
Donovan.

	Donovan's most popular songs were "Mellow, Yellow" and "Sunshine Superman".

questions.text: What did Ringo have in his pocket that helped free the Sgt Pepper's Band?
options: nothing, he wasn't the one who saved them
questions.explanation:
a hole.

	Ringo had taken a hole from the sea of holes as a souvenir and it came in handy when they needed to break the giant bubble that the Sgt Pepper's Band was in.  "I've got a hole in me pocket!"

questions.text: What was the name of the "Nowhere Man"?
questions.explanation:
Jeremy.

	His full name is Jeremy Hilary Boob, Ph.D and he sure did know a lot of things! Dick Emery provided the voice for this wonderful character.

questions.text: What does the letter "H" stand for when Old Fred asks for the Beatles' assistance?
questions.explanation:
Hurry.

	H is for hurry, E is for urgent, L is for love me, P is for please...help.  Lance Percival provided the voice for Old Fred.

questions.text: Near the end of the film who does the Chief Blue Meanie admit is his cousin?
questions.explanation:
The Bluebird of Happiness.

	The Chief Blue Meanie's right hand man was Max.

questions.text: On which day of the week does Old Fred enlist the Beatles' aid?
questions.explanation:
Thursday.

	It was a Thursday or "Sitterday".

questions.text: What sea does Ringo get thrown into?
questions.explanation:
The Sea of Monsters.

	Ringo hits the panic button (even though Old Fred told him not to) and gets thrown into the Sea of Monsters, where he meets up with some interesting creatures.

questions.text: What year was the movie released in the US?
questions.explanation:
1968.

	The movie was re-released on DVD and video in 1998.

questions.text: In the re-release, what song was added that had been cut from the original version?
options: Lucy in the Sky with Diamonds
questions.explanation:
Hey Bulldog.

	The producers deleted the "Hey Bulldog" sequence but luckily it was restored in the re-released version.
